entry.content:
New Delhi: This time the hosting of Champions Trophy 2025 is in the hands of Pakistan. Pakistani fans are very happy that their team seems to be the biggest contender to win the Champions Trophy title, but in reality the story seems to be just the opposite. Despite being the host, Pakistan is looking very weak in the Champions Trophy. The condition of the Pakistani team seems very weak. Pakistani fans may be dreaming of winning the Champions Trophy, but their team is not even able to win a match against Zimbabwe. Zimbabwe has defeated them in a T20 match.

Zimbabwe seal a thrilling win over Pakistan in the 3rd and final T20I!

‚Äî FanCode (@FanCode) December 5, 2024

Pakistan loses:
A three-match T20 series was played between Pakistan and Zimbabwe. Although Pakistan won the series 2-1, they suffered a crushing defeat in the last match of the series. Pakistan was defeated by Zimbabwe by 2 wickets in the third T20 match. This match between the two teams was quite exciting. They defeated Pakistan in the last over of this match. For a moment it seemed that Pakistan would win this match easily, but a Zimbabwean player snatched the match from them.

How was the match?
Talking about the match played between the two teams, Pakistan captain Salman Agha won the toss and decided to bat first. After his decision, Pakistan’s team batted first and scored 132 runs in 20 overs losing 7 wickets. After this, Zimbabwe’s team came on the field to chase the target of 133 runs. Where they scored 133 runs in 19.5 overs losing 8 wickets. Zimbabwe needed 9 runs to win in the last over. They won the match with one ball remaining in the last over.

entry.title: Pushpa 2 box-office collection Day 1: Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna actioner sets BO on fire, beats Jawan, Kalki 2898 AD, Animal, earns Rs…
entry.summary: Pushpa 2, starring Rashmika Mandanna and Allu Arjun, has already earned a whopping amount at the box office its opening day, making it one of the most successful film launches in recent history.
entry.content:
The anticipation for Pushpa 2 has been nothing short of monumental, with fans across the country buzzing with excitement ahead of its release. The film has not only lived up to the hype but has also set new records, crushing many of Bollywood‚Äôs biggest blockbusters in terms of opening-day collections. Scroll down to find more details.

Pushpa 2: Allu Arjun-Rashmika Mandanna set record numbers from day 1- check detailed report

According to Saknilk, Pushpa 2, starring Rashmika Mandanna and Allu Arjun, has already earned a staggering Rs 132.27 crores at the box office by 9:30 AM on its opening day, making it one of the most successful film launches in recent history. With this impressive start, the film has broken records previously held by some of Bollywood‚Äôs biggest hits, including Kalki 2898 AD, Jawan, Pathaan, and Animal.

The film’s opening day earnings have surpassed the collection of Kalki 2898 AD, which had earned Rs 95.3 crore on its opening day. Pushpa 2 has exceeded that number with ease. In comparison, Shah Rukh Khan’s Jawan collected Rs 75 crore on day one, while Pathaan earned Rs 57 crore, and Ranbir Kapoor’s Animal managed Rs63.8 crore on its opening day. All these films were expected to dominate the box office, but Pushpa 2 has stolen the limelight by surpassing these numbers effortlessly.

Experts predict that Pushpa 2 is set to cross the Rs 180 crore mark by the end of its opening day, a record that might put it ahead of other highly anticipated films like Kalki 2898 and Salaar, both of which are set to release later this year.

About Pushpa 2

Directed by Sukumar, Pushpa 2 is the sequel to the immensely successful Pushpa (2021). The film once again features Allu Arjun in the titular role, with Rashmika Mandanna reprising her role alongside him in an action-packed and emotional storyline. Fans are already raving about the powerful performances, the intense drama, and the stunning visuals, cementing Pushpa 2 as one of the most successful films of the year.

entry.title: Hayat Tahrir al-Sham rebels may capture the Russian naval base in Syria, as Putin‚Äôs army launches… ; the Russian Army is removing….
entry.summary: Besides HTS, the Turkey-backed militia, Syrian National Army, is also involved in the war. Meanwhile, the UN's Special Envoy for Syria, Geir O. Pedersen, stated that thousands of civilians have fled the region due to the conflict. Amid rising tensions, Russia has removed its five warships and one submarine.
entry.content:
The Russian forces are engaged in intense fighting in Syria after Ukraine. After capturing Aleppo, rebels of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) are moving forward to Hama. After Hama, the rebels will move towards the city of Tartus where the Russian forces have made a Naval base. Now, Russian forces have started launching missiles on HTS rebels.

Syrian forces have also targeted rebels to push them back. Turkey-backed rebels can capture Khmeimim Air Base anytime soon. Syrian President Bashar al-Assad had given this airbase to Russian forces in 2015. After the development, the Syrian President got an edge in the civil war.

Hama is Syria’s fourth-largest city. On December 4, Russian forces launched a massive offensive against the rebels, pushing them back by 10 kilometers. For the safety of Syria’s capital, Damascus, Assad’s forces must not allow Hama to fall into the hands of the rebels. Hama is also considered as the gateway of coastal cities Tartus and Latakia.

Besides HTS, the Turkey-backed militia, Syrian National Army, is also involved in the war. Meanwhile, the UN’s Special Envoy for Syria, Geir O. Pedersen, stated that thousands of civilians have fled the region due to the conflict. Amid rising tensions, Russia has removed its five warships and one submarine. On December 2, the Russian auxiliary ship Yelnya departed from Tartus. Now, President Assad appears to be on the backfoot, with rebels setting their sights on Damascus.

Experts believe that Russia won’t be able to help Assad if it is removing its warships and submarines. This clearly indicates that the situation in Syria could worsen at any time, they added.

entry.title: Not only UPSC topper IAS Tina Dabi and IAS officer Ria Dabi, know about sisters who have cracked UPSC exam to become IAS officers
entry.summary: IAS Tina Dabi and her younger sister, IAS Ria Dabi, have become famous internet personalities in India, since both sisters both aced the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) and became renowned IAS officers.
entry.content:
Tina Dabi and her sister Ria Dabi have become nothing short of celebrities since both aced the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) and became renowned IAS officers. But did you know that apart from Dabi sisters, there are other sister duos who have achieved the same feat. Let us take a look at some of the pairs of sisters who have topped UPSC exams and are currently serving as IAS officers in various parts of the country.

Tina Dabi and Ria Dabi

Perhaps the most famous and celebrated pair of sisters to have cracked the UPSC CSE, Tina Dabi and her younger sister, Ria Dabi, have become famous internet personalities in India.

While Tina was the first to ace the tough exam, emerging as the topper in the UPSC CSE 2016, securing the coveted All India Rank (AIR) 1, her younger sibling, Ria cleared UPSC in 2020, securing an impressive 15th AIR. Both Tina and Ria cracked the UPSC CSE in their first attempt.

Ankita Jain and Vaishali Jain

Ankita Jain and her sister Vaishali Jain achieved the feat in 2020, when both sisters cleared the UPSC CSE in the same year. Ankita and Vaishali, natives of Agra in Uttar Pradesh, put a splendid performance, achieving the 3rd and 21st ranks in the exam, respectively. Both are currently serving as IAS officers.

Anamika Meena and Anjali Meena

Anamika Meena and Anjali Meena cracked UPSC CSE in 2019, achieving 116th and 494th rank in the country’s toughest examination. Both Anamika and Anjali are serving as IAS officers today. Notably, their father, Rameshchand Meena, is also an IAS officer of Tamil Nadu cadre.

Pushpa 2 actor Allu Arjun is now in big trouble after Chikkadapally police station filed a complaint against the actor and the film crew after a shocking incident made headlines this morning. A 35-year-old fan died due to a stampede that took place outside the Sandhya Theater, while Allu Arjun departed from the cinema hall. Now a case has been filed against Pushpa 2 movie unit, Telugu actor Allu Arjun, owner of Sandhya Theater, Allu Arjun’s security wing. Read on to find more details.

Case filed against Pushpa 2 actor Allu Arjun

A case has been registered in Chikkadapally police station against Allu Arjun, owner of Sandhya Theater, Allu Arjun’s security wing, Pushpa 2 movie unit under BNS Act of 105, 118(1)r/w3(5) by Central Zone DCP Akansh Yadav.

A sea of Allu Arjun fans gathered to witness their hero ahead of the premier of the highly anticipated film Pushpa 2: The Rule. A news report by The Hindu quoted a Chikkadpally Police official that revealed, “There was no information about their arrival until two hours before, and hence no bandobast was organised. entry.title: Travel Through The Best Travel Routes To Dharwad From Various Cities
entry.summary: Reaching Dharwad is convenient with air travel, scenic trains, and flexible bus services from major cities. Plan your route and explore its rich history, vibrant culture, and thrilling adventures
entry.content:
Dharwad, a city located in Karnataka state, is a cultural and historical treasure waiting to be discovered. The place has so much to offer with its heritage sites and vibrant local life for those who wish to travel. But before you discover the charm of this city, you should know how to get there. If you are starting your journey from Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata or Bangalore here is a complete guide on how to reach Dharwad which includes various means of transport available.

From Delhi

By Flight

The shortest route between Delhi and Dharwad is by air. Just take a flight from Indira Gandhi International Airport which flies into Hubli Airport after which take a short 30-minute bus or taxi ride and you will be in Dharwad. You can easily find an appropriate choice that suits your schedule since several flights are operated by airlines such as IndiGo, SpiceJet and Air India.

By Train

If one prefers looking outside windows while traveling rather than being closed inside then trains provide an excellent opportunity for traveling between Delhi to Dharwad. Take a train from Hazrat Nizamuddin Railway Station or New Delhi Railway Station going towards Dharwad RailwaY Station. This journey might last longer ‚Äì from 24 up to 30 hours but it gives you the opportunity of witnessing change in the landscapes of India as many trains like Karnataka Express, Goa Express and Hampi express go frequently on this route.

By Bus

For travelers on a budget or road trip enthusiasts, overnight buses are best suited for them. From either Anand Vihar Bus Terminal or Kashmere Gate Bus Terminal in Delhi you can catch one of the overnight buses that will take a 24-30 hour ride to Dharwad. RSRTC, HRTC as well as different private operators have several buses daily so that their schedules are flexible.

From Mumbai

By Flight

The fastest way to reach Hubli from Mumbai is by flying. At the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport look for a flight going to Hubli Airport then alight at Dharwad after some minutes of travel. IndiGo, SpiceJet and Air India airlines have multiple flights every day, which makes it easy for you to plan your journey.

By Train

Another reliable alternative to reach Dharwad from Mumbai is through trains. Leave either Lokmanya Tilak Terminus or Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus and go on an 18-22 hours journey heading to Dharwad Railway Station. You can choose the train that matches your preference since there are trains like Goa Express, Karnataka Express and Hampi Express that ply this route.

By Bus

Buses from Borivali or Thane provide comfort and affordability to those wishing to travel by road from Mumbai to Dharwad. If you want an overnight trip take any bus which takes 18-22 hours and lands you in Dharwad. Several buses for MSRTC and private operators are available each day so that people‚Äôs plans can be changed according to what they want.

From Kolkata

By Flight

Kolkata passengers can fly into Hubli Airport in order to get to Dharwad. Just catch a flight from Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport going towards Hubli before proceeding with your journey up until reaching Dharwad town. Many flights operated by IndiGo, SpiceJet and Air India run throughout the day.

By Train

If you prefer scenic routes from Kolkata to Dharwad, then trains provide good traveling options although they take a lot more time. You will have to take a train from Howrah Junction which will take approximately 30-36 hours to reach Dharwad Railway Station. The two cities are connected with each other by means of trains such as Howrah-Hospet Express and Yesvantpur-Howrah Express.

By Bus

Buses that travel overnight from Kolkata to Dharwad are ideal for budget conscious travelers. As it takes 30-36 hours to get to Dharwad, leave from Esplanade or Salt Lake. WBSTC and private operators run several buses daily, which allows for flexibility in your itinerary.

From Bangalore

By Bus

Travelers can board a bus from Kempegowda Bus Station or Shivajinagar Bus Station going to Dharwad. KSRTC buses and those operated by private players will take you there within 6-8 hours‚Äô drive time.

By Car

Driving from Bangalore to Dharwad is a great option if you love the freedom of the road. Take NH48 road and enjoy a trip that stretches about 420 kilometers through scenic landscapes that can be covered in between seven to eight hours.

By Train

Trains are the most comfortable and fastest mode of travel when journeying from Bangalore city in India to Dehradun city (Dharampur). It is an 8-10 hour journey from Yesvantpur Junction (Railway Station) or Bangalore City Junction Railway station to Dharwad railway station.Therefore Hampi Express, Karnataka express, etc operate multiple times every day hence giving enough room for changes on traveling plans.

entry.title: Meet Karisma Kapoor’s first hero, became superstar at just 15, one incident destroyed his career forever, his debut film was‚Ä¶
entry.summary: Karisma made her grand entrance with Prem Qaidi, alongside a child actor who was making his mark in Bollywood. While Karisma‚Äôs career soared to new heights after the success of Prem Qaidi,
entry.content:
Karisma Kapoor shattered the Kapoor family’s long-standing tradition when she made her Bollywood debut in 1991. Prior to this, no woman from the Kapoor family had actively pursued a career in acting. Even actresses who married into the Kapoor family, such as Neetu Kapoor and Babita Kapoor, had distanced themselves from the film industry. Karisma made her grand entrance with Prem Qaidi, alongside a child actor who was making his mark in Bollywood. While Karisma‚Äôs career soared to new heights after the success of Prem Qaidi, this child artist despite starring in several hit films, faded from the industry after a tragic accident. Let’s explore where Harish Kumar is now and what led to his career’s downfall.

Meet Karisma Kapoor’s first hero

Harish Kumar’s journey in the film industry began at just 13 years old when he appeared as a child artist in the 1983 film Andhra Kesari. His impressive performance earned him the Nandi Award for Best Child Artist, a prestigious honor presented by the then-Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, N.T. Rama Rao, himself a former actor and filmmaker. This early recognition helped Harish establish a promising future in acting.

Harish Kumar made his debut as a lead actor in the Malayalam film Daisy before making his Bollywood debut with Prem Qaidi in 1991, opposite Karishma Kapoor. The film was a box office success, and Harish quickly gained recognition for his performance. He then went on to star in several successful films, including Tiranga and Coolie No. 1. His career was on an upward trajectory, with many fans and critics taking notice of his talent.

Tragic Injury and Career Setback

However, Harish’s promising career came to a halt after a severe back injury in 2001. He sustained a slip disc, which left him in constant pain and made even simple tasks, like walking to the bathroom, extremely difficult. His L3 and L5 vertebrae were damaged, leaving him unable to continue working in films. Doctors advised complete bed rest, and Harish slowly withdrew from the limelight. His absence became so prolonged that it was unclear for years what had happened to him.

A New Journey Behind the Camera

Despite stepping away from acting, Harish Kumar didn‚Äôt sever his ties with the film industry. He transitioned into the world of filmmaking, focusing on writing scripts, dialogues, and screenplays for various projects. Although he‚Äôs no longer in front of the camera, his passion for cinema remains intact. Harish may have left the spotlight, but he continues to contribute to the industry in his own way, proving that his love for movies never truly faded.

entry.title: Rashid Khan and 2 other star players get angry at Taliban, come out in support of…

entry.content:
New Delhi: Rashid Khan and Mohammad Nabi, the biggest names in Afghanistan cricket, have slammed the Taliban. The Taliban has announced the closure of training camps where nurses and doctors are trained, both the legendary cricketers have reportedly strongly criticized the closure of institutes related to women’s training. The restrictions are a fresh setback to women‚Äôs rights in Afghanistan since the Taliban took over in August 2021, the Taliban have banned secondary and higher education for girls and women, with the exception of the medical field.

Girls and women were also banned from participating in the sport, after which the Afghanistan team came under the radar as a full member of the ICC last year. Rashid wrote in the Instagram story that education has a central place in Islam, which emphasizes the pursuit of knowledge for both men and women.

pic.twitter.com/rYtNtNaw14

‚Äî Rashid Khan (@rashidkhan_19) December 4, 2024

He further wrote that the Quran highlights the importance of learning and acknowledges the equal spiritual worth of men and women. In his post, Rashid expressed his views on the closure of educational and medical institutes. At the same time, he described the acute shortage of nurses in the country as a matter of concern.

Whereas Mohammad Nabi wrote on X (formerly Twitter) – the Taliban’s decision to ban girls from studying medicine is not only heartbreaking but also extremely unjust. Nabi wrote – Islam has always emphasized the importance of education for all, and history is replete with inspiring examples of Muslim women who have made significant contributions to many generations through knowledge.

pic.twitter.com/SbSv5lblcz

Nabi further wrote in his post – I urge the Taliban to consider these values. Not giving girls a chance to learn and serve their people is a betrayal of both their dreams and the future of our country. entry.title: Bad news for Noel Tata as Ratan Tata’s Tata Motors may miss key target again due to…
entry.summary: The drop in Tata Motors' EV sales comes as a major setback for the Tata Group, nearly two months after the conglomerate lost its Chairman Emeritus, Ratan Tata, who died. Following Ratan's demise, his half-brother Noel Tata, was picked as the new chairman of Tata Trusts, an umbrella group of charities which holds 66% stake in Tata Sons -- the holding company of Tata Group.
entry.content:
In a major setback for Tata Trusts Chairman, Noel Tata, Tata Motors is poised to miss its intended target of selling 100,000 units of EVs for the second year in a row. According to a report by the Economic Times, Tata Motors, the largest electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer in India, is likely to record lower EV sales this fiscal compared to last year.

As per the ET report, Tata Motors has witnessed a 11.2% year-on- year decline in wholesales or dispatches to dealers in the first eight months of this fiscal year through March, dispatching only 42,778 units, which is significantly lower than its 73,844 EV sales in last financial year. Notably, the automaker had witnessed a remarkable 48% jump in sales in FY24, but the current numbers suggest that the company is well on its way to experience its first sales decline since it ventured into the EV market in FY21.

Market slowdown, de-incentivisation key reasons for low sales

According to market analysts, various factors, such as the broader slowdown witnessed in the domestic car market, in addition to withdrawal of EV incentives by some states as well as the central government, are some of the reasons for Tata Motors’ drop in EV sales, despite the company introducing a couple of new models in the market.

Tata Group Chairman, N Chandrasekaran, who also heads Tata Motors, had set a goal for the company to double its EV sales in this fiscal, but currently it looks like that the carmaker will miss that target of 100,000 unit sales for the second year in a row.

A Tata Motors spokesperson blamed the slump on the slowdown in EV adoption in the country, and the withdrawal of incentives by the state and central governments. “In FY25, the entire passenger car industry is witnessing flattish growth and the slowdown in the EV adoption curve can be corelated to this. Further, discontinuity in central and state policies incentivising EV purchase have also contributed to this slowdown,” the report quoted the spokesperson as saying.

Tata Motors records modest growth in Nov

Meanwhile, on Sunday, Tata Motors reported a marginal increase in overall sales at 74,753 units in November as compared to 74,172 units in the same month last year. In a statement, Tata Motors said its total domestic sales were up 1 per cent at 73,246 units last month as against 72,647 units in November 2023.

Total passenger vehicle (PV) sales, including EVs, were at 47,117 units as compared to 46,143 units in the year-ago month, up 2 per cent, it added.

Setback for Noel Tata

The drop in Tata Motors’ EV sales comes as a major setback for the Tata Group, nearly two months after the conglomerate lost its Chairman Emeritus, Ratan Tata, who died due to age-related issues at Mumbai’s Breach Candy Hospital on October 9. He was 86.

Following Ratan Tata’s demise, his half-brother Noel Tata, was picked as the new chairman of Tata Trusts, an umbrella group of charities which holds 66% stake in Tata Sons — the holding company of Tata Group.

After Ratan Tata’s death, Noel Tata, 67, was picked by the board to lead Tata Trusts, which essentially owns Tata Sons, having a 66 percent stake in the holding company which runs the Tata Group, essentially making Noel, the single most powerful person in the Rs 34 lakh crore Tata business empire.

The Tata Group, established by its founder Jamshedji Nasirwanji Tata in 1868 when he bought a bankrupt oil mill for Rs 21,000, a massive amount at the time, and turned it into a cotton factory, has today grown into a global juggernaut with over 100 companies spread in more than 100 countries, boasting a market cap of $403 billion (roughly Rs 33.7 trillion).

(With inputs from agencies)

entry.title: Scared Pakistan plans to boost its air force by using Chinese-made fifth-generation fighter aircraft, can India’s Rafael outperform it?
entry.summary: The defence acquisition is part of Pakistan Air Force‚Äôs (PAF) plan to enhance its air attack capabilities.
entry.content:
In a potential bad news for India, Pakistan has reportedly approved the purchase of a new Chinese-made fifth-generation fighter jet. The Chinese-made fifth-generation fighter jet named as Shenyang J-35 is a series of Chinese twin-engine, all-weather, stealth multirole combat aircraft. Manufactured by Shenyang Aircraft Corporation (SAC), the aircraft is designed for air superiority and surface strike missions.

The defence acquisition is part of Pakistan Air Force‚Äôs (PAF) plan to enhance its air attack capabilities. Moreover, as a cause of concern for India, the Shenyang J-35 is expected to outperform India‚Äôs advanced fighters, such as the Rafale and Sukhoi Su-30MKI. The advantage of the own fifth-generation fighter jets is expected to remain with Pakistan until India secures its own.

The J-35, a masterpiece of Shenyang Aircraft Corporation, is designed to tackle both air and ground combat. Early signs of its importation into Pakistan’s fleet are apparent as Pakistani Air Force pilots are right now in China honing their skills in manoeuvring this advanced aircraft. This is a major move by Pakistan, as it is in line with its grand scheme to breathe new life into its air force, replacing the somewhat dated F-16s and Mirage 5s with cutting-edge fighter jets.

About J-35A stealth fighter jet

China’s new J-35A stealth fighter jet debuted in November at the country’s biggest civil and military air show during a flying display, Chinese state television CCTV reported. The J-35A, which uses airstrips to take off and land, is a variant of the J-35, a stealthy aircraft China is developing for use on aircraft carriers.

The J-35A was designed and built by the Shenyang Aircraft Corporation, a unit of the state-owned Aviation Industry Corporation of China. Little is known about its performance or capabilities, although it superficially resembles the Lockheed Martin LMT.N F-35.

The state-controlled People’s Daily news outlet said ahead of the air show the J-35A “mainly carries out the task of seizing and maintaining air supremacy.”

The six-day China International Aviation & Aerospace Exhibition, a biennial event where Beijing showcases its expanding aerospace industry, takes place in Zhuhai from Nov. 12-17.

(With inputs from agencies)

entry.title: Who is Avadh Ojha? Know the secrets behind his transition from UPSC teacher to an AAP leader
entry.summary: Avadh Ojha believes that students should not take the UPSC lightly and must dedicate seven hours daily for one year. Anything less than this will not lead to success.
entry.content:
Avadh Ojha has become a well-known educator in the country. His teaching style has gained him popularity and become a symbol of excellence.

Avadh Ojha is also a famous motivational speaker. He is followed by lakhs of subscribers on YouTube. There is an interesting story behind his becoming an educator and motivational speaker.

Today, Avadh Ojha is a role model for lakhs of students. His earnings are in crores. Let‚Äôs know about his journey from an educator to an Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader..

Avadh Pratap Ojha born on July 3, 1984 in Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs Gonda. Avadh Ojha‚Äôs father, Mata Prasad Ojha was a postmaster. It is said that Mata Prasad Ojha sold 5 acres of land so he can afford the studies of his wife. Avadh Ojha‚Äôs mother is an advocate.

entry.title: Explore 5 Unique Features That Make Araku Valley Talk Between Tourist
entry.summary: Nestled in the Eastern Ghats of Andhra Pradesh, the Araku Valley paints a breathtaking picture with its green-covered hills and calm waterfalls. It has turned into a sought-after haven for explorers in search of peace and quiet.
entry.content:
Nestled amidst the Eastern Ghats of India, Araku Valley stands as a testament to nature’s unparalleled beauty and serenity. Tucked away in the heart of Andhra Pradesh, this picturesque valley has emerged as a haven for travelers seeking solace in the lap of verdant hills, cascading waterfalls, and tranquil landscapes. But what truly makes Araku Valley famous? Let’s embark on a journey to uncover the secrets and allure of this hidden gem.

 

1.A Symphony of Nature’s Splendor

Araku Valley’s fame primarily stems from its breathtaking natural scenery. As you traverse through its winding roads, enveloped by lush greenery and mist-kissed mountains, you’re greeted by a spectacle that captivates the soul. The valley is adorned with sprawling coffee plantations, orchards laden with fruits, and dense forests teeming with diverse flora and fauna. Every corner exudes a sense of tranquility, inviting visitors to immerse themselves in the embrace of Mother Nature.

 

2.The Aroma of Araku Coffee

One of the most renowned aspects of Araku Valley is its exquisite coffee. The region’s cool climate and rich soil create the perfect environment for cultivating high-quality Arabica and Robusta coffee beans. Araku coffee, with its distinctive aroma and flavor, has garnered acclaim both nationally and internationally. Travelers flock to the valley to witness the coffee-making process firsthand, from plucking ripe cherries to roasting and grinding the beans. The local coffee estates not only offer a sensory delight but also provide insights into the traditional techniques passed down through generations.

 

3.Cultural Tapestry of Tribes

Beyond its natural splendor, Araku Valley is home to a vibrant tapestry of indigenous tribes, each contributing to the region’s cultural richness. The tribal communities, including the Galikonda, Khond, and Konda Dora, have preserved their age-old traditions, customs, and craftsmanship. Visitors have the opportunity to engage with these tribes, gaining a deeper understanding of their way of life through dance performances, handicraft demonstrations, and interactions with local artisans. The warmth and hospitality of the tribal people leave an indelible mark on every traveler’s heart, fostering a sense of connection and appreciation for indigenous cultures.

 

4.Mesmerizing Waterfalls and Caves

Araku Valley is adorned with numerous natural wonders, including enchanting waterfalls and mysterious caves. The Katiki Waterfall, with its cascading torrents of water amidst verdant surroundings, offers a refreshing retreat for weary souls. Similarly, the Chaparai Waterfalls, hidden amidst dense forests, beckon adventurers to explore their pristine beauty. For those with an inclination towards spelunking, the Borra Caves present an intriguing adventure. These million-year-old limestone caves, adorned with stalactites and stalagmites, evoke a sense of wonder and awe, making them a must-visit destination in the valley.

 

5. Eco-Tourism and Sustainable Practices

Araku Valley has emerged as a frontrunner in eco-tourism, promoting sustainable practices to preserve its natural heritage. The local community has taken initiatives to conserve biodiversity, protect wildlife habitats, and promote responsible tourism. Visitors are encouraged to partake in eco-friendly activities such as nature walks, bird watching, and tree plantation drives. Additionally, the valley hosts events and workshops focused on environmental awareness and conservation, fostering a sense of responsibility towards the planet among travelers and locals alike.

By introducing TVKey Cloud, Samsung is reshaping the future of home entertainment. This revolutionary technology empowers consumers to enjoy their favorite shows and movies with unparalleled convenience and security.

entry.title: Samsung’s One UI 7: A Glimpse into the Future of Mobile AI

entry.content:
Samsung Electronics has taken a significant step towards the future of mobile AI with the launch of its One UI 7 beta program. This latest iteration of Samsung’s user interface promises to revolutionize the way users interact with their Galaxy devices, offering a plethora of AI-powered features designed to enhance productivity, personalization, and overall user experience.

One UI 7 introduces a suite of AI-driven tools that streamline various tasks. One UI 7 introduces a new feature called the Now Bar, which appears on the lock screen, providing quick access to essential notifications and activities. This eliminates the need to unlock the device for every interaction, making it easier for users to stay on top of their tasks.

The One UI 7 beta program is currently available to Galaxy S24 series users in select countries. Samsung plans to release the official version in the first quarter of 2025, with additional AI features and broader device compatibility to follow.

With One UI 7, Samsung is poised to set new standards in mobile AI, offering users a more intelligent, efficient, and personalized smartphone experience.

entry.title: Bad news for Iran as US makes big move to make Tehran beg for money, will also destroy 2 Indian companies dealing in…
entry.summary: US Department of Treasury said the new sanctions imposes additional costs on petroleum sector of Iran following Iran‚Äôs attack against Israel on October 1, as well as Tehran‚Äôs announced nuclear escalations, building upon the sanctions issued on October 11.
entry.content:
Iran sanctions: In more trouble for Iran, which is embroiled in a raging conflict with Israel on multiple fronts in the Middle East, the United States has imposed sanction on as many as 35 companies and ships, including two Indian firms, that transport Iran’s oil to other countries. The move has the potential to bankrupt Iran by putting more strain on its already fragile economy which has borne the brunt of sanctions by US and its allies for decades.

On Tuesday, the US Department of the Treasury announced that it was imposing sanctions of 35 companies and ships, which include two Indian firms — Vision Ship Management LLP, that manages and operates the PHONIX, and Tightship Shipping Management (OPC) Private Limited.

In a statement, the Department of Treasury said this action imposes additional costs on Iran‚Äôs petroleum sector following Iran‚Äôs attack against Israel on October 1, as well as Tehran‚Äôs announced nuclear escalations, building upon the sanctions issued on October 11.

Petroleum revenues provide the Iranian regime with the resources to fund its nuclear program, develop advanced drones and missiles, and provide ongoing financial and material support for the terrorist activities of its regional proxies, it said.

‚ÄúIran continues to funnel revenues from its petroleum trade toward the development of its nuclear program, proliferation of its ballistic missile and unmanned aerial vehicle technology, and sponsorship of its regional terrorist proxies, risking further destabilizing the region,” said Acting Under Secretary for Terrorism and Financial Intelligence, Bradley T Smith.

Smith said the US remains committed to “disrupting the shadow fleet of vessels and operators that facilitate these illicit activities, using the full range of our tools and authorities”.

Sanctions slapped on Indian firms

According to the Treasury, India-based Vision Ship Management LLP manages and operates the PHONIX, formerly known as the LUNA LAKE, which has carried millions of barrels of Iranian crude oil for CCPC since 2022.

The company also owns, manages, and operates the Cook Islands-flagged RIO NAPO (IMO: 9256913) and the Panama-flagged LARA II (IMO: 9321421). The RIO NAPO previously transported 35,000 metric tons of Iranian naphtha worth approximately $21.5 million to the UAE, it said.

India-based Tightship Shipping Management (OPC) Private Limited manages or operates the OLIVE, BLACK PANTHER, and LIONESS, which have collectively carried tens of millions of dollars‚Äô worth of Iranian oil for NIOC since at least 2022.

The BLACK PANTHER has engaged in ship-to-ship transfers of Iranian oil with Iranian-flagged vessels.

Tightship Shipping Management (OPC) Private Limited is involved in the management of a fourth vessel, the Panama-flagged TONIL (IMO: 9307932), which is managed and operated by Ukraine-based Lightship Management Ltd and has skirted sanctions to carry millions of barrels of oil for Iran, the Treasury alleged.

Tightship Shipping Management (OPC) Private Limited and Lightship Management Ltd are being designated pursuant to E.O. 13902 for operating in the petroleum sector of the Iranian economy.

The OLIVE, the BLACK PANTHER, and the LIONESS are being identified as property in which Tightship Shipping Management (OPC) Private Limited has an interest.

The TONIL is being identified as property in which Lightship Management Ltd has an interest.

(With PTI inputs)

entry.title: State Bank of India and other banks to remain closed tomorrow in Maharashtra on Mahaparinirvan Diwas? All you need to know
entry.summary: Liquor shops will remain closed on Friday as the Mumbai city collector has declared it a dry day on the occasion Mahaparinirvan Diwas
entry.content:
Mahaparinirvan Diwas: The Maharashtra government has declared a local holiday on December 6 for Mumbai and suburban areas on the occasion of Mahaparinirvan Diwas 2024. The authorities have released a notification stating that a local holiday has been declared for the state government and semi-government offices in Mumbai and suburban areas.

Notably, this is the third such local holiday given by the government after Dahi Handi and Ganesh Visarjan. The government is anticipating a large number of people to gather on December 6 to to pay homage to Dr BR Ambedkar on his 68th death anniversary at Chaityabhoomi, where Ambedkar was cremated.

It is located at Shivaji Park, less than 2 km from the Dadar station.

What’s open on December 6?

  1. All public and private banks in Maharashtra, including the State Bank of India (SBI), will function as usual.
  2. BSE and NSE will continue to function as normal tomorrow, i.e., on December 6.

What will remain closed?

  1. The Maharashtra government has declared a local holiday for state government and semi-government offices in Mumbai and suburban areas.
  2. As per Mid Day report, liquor shops will remain closed tomorrow as the Mumbai city collector has declared it a dry day.

Special Trains

  • The Central Railway has made adequate arrangements with special trains, help desks, and security for incoming passengers.
  • Central Railway will operate 12 additional suburban trains–six on the main line and six on the harbour line on the nights of December 5 and 6.
  • The holding area created in open space between Central Railway and Western Railway lines
  • The space can accommodate 7,000 to 8,000 people.
  • Separate entry and exit points have been planned at Dadar for proper crowd management.
  • Besides showing the way to Chaityabhoomi and Rajgruh, the residence where Ambedkar once lived and which is now a memorial, the Central Railway has displayed numbers and timings of special trains operated by it near the enquiry office at Mumbai CSMT, Dadar, Thane, and Kalyan stations.
  • Special ticket checking squad/staff, along with RPF/GRP personnel, have been deployed at the train originating stations in front of reserved coaches to ensure entry of only bonafide passengers.\
  • Platform tickets are being issued to only select groups of people, including senior citizens and divyangs (persons with disabilities), till 9 December at major stations like CSMT, Dadar, Thane, and Kalyan, said Swapnil Nila.

entry.title: Jay Shah visits ICC headquarters in Dubai, makes a MASSIVE statement about…
entry.summary: Jay Shah took over as ICC Chairman on 1 December. On 5 December, Shah visited the ICC headquarters in Dubai for the first time as ICC President where he had a special meeting with the directors and staff of the ICC Board.
entry.content:
New Delhi: Jay Shah took over as ICC Chairman on 1 December. On 5 December, Shah visited the ICC headquarters in Dubai for the first time as ICC President where he had a special meeting with the directors and staff of the ICC Board.

Shah said after his visit, ‘This tour provided me with an invaluable opportunity to connect with my colleagues on the ICC Board, where we discussed the initial roadmap and strategies to shape the future of this incredible game. I was also delighted to meet the dedicated ICC team who work tirelessly to take cricket forward.’

.@JayShah, the newly elected Chair of the International Cricket Council (ICC), paid a visit to the ICC Headquarters in Dubai on Thursday.

More here: https://t.co/FJsMuBvOjE pic.twitter.com/rU9phtUdZd

‚Äî ICC (@ICC) December 5, 2024

Shah described his visit as useful and inspiring and acknowledged the long road ahead. He said, ‘I am excited by what I saw, but I believe that this is just the beginning. The hard work to take cricket to unprecedented heights has now begun and I am confident that together we will achieve this goal.’

At the same time, ICC Vice President Imran Khwaja also praised Shah’s ambitious vision for the game. Khwaja said, ‘On behalf of the board, I would like to welcome Mr. Jay Shah to this position and share my enthusiasm for his tenure. Mr Shah’s ambition and experience will help guide the ICC and the game in the future. It has been a very useful tour for everyone. We look forward to working closely with him, the members and the ICC team to achieve success.’

It is worth noting that today an important meeting of the ICC is to be held regarding the controversy of the Champions Trophy, which is going to be chaired by Jay Shah. It is expected that after this meeting, there will be an official announcement regarding organizing the Champions Trophy under the hybrid model. After being adamant for a long time, the PCB has had to bow down to the ICC. Dubai can be chosen as a neutral venue.
